Package de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core

Class CoreShader

java.lang.Object
de.lessvoid.nifty.render.batch.core.CoreShader
public class CoreShader extends Object
Represents an abstraction of an OpenGL shader. It is actually a combination of a vertex shader & a fragment shader, which in OpenGL is referred to as a 'program'.

  • Method Details

    • createShader

      @Nonnull public static CoreShader createShader(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory)
      Creates a new Shader.
      Returns:
      The new CoreShader instance.

    • createShaderWithVertexAttributes

      @Nonnull public static CoreShader createShaderWithVertexAttributes(@Nonnull CoreGL gl, @Nonnull BufferFactory bufferFactory, @Nonnull String... vertexAttributes)
      Creates a new Shader with the specified vertex attributes that automatically binds to the generic attribute indices in ascending order beginning with 0. This method can be used when you want to control the vertex attribute binding on your own.
      Parameters:
      vertexAttributes - The name of the vertex attribute. The first String gets generic attribute index 0. The second String gets generic attribute index 1 and so on.
      Returns:
      The CoreShader instance.

    • vertexShader

      public int vertexShader(@Nonnull String filename)
      Attaches the specified vertex shader file to this CoreShader. This calls glCreateShader(), loads and compiles the shader source, and finally attaches the shader.
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename of the shader.

    • fragmentShader

      public int fragmentShader(@Nonnull String filename)
      Attaches the specified fragment shader file to this CoreShader. This calls glCreateShader(), loads and compiles the shader source, and finally attaches the shader.
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename of the shader.

    • setUniformf

      public void setUniformf(@Nonnull String name, float v1, float v2)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified value (two floats = vec2).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform to set.
      v1 - The first component of the vec2.
      v2 - The second component of the vec2.

    • setUniformf

      public void setUniformf(@Nonnull String name, float v1, float v2, float v3)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified value (three floats = vec3).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform to set.
      v1 - The first component of the vec3.
      v2 - The second component of the vec3.
      v3 - The third component of the vec3.

    • setUniformf

      public void setUniformf(@Nonnull String name, float x, float y, float z, float w)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified value (four floats = vec4).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform to set.
      x - The first component of the vec4.
      y - The second component of the vec4.
      z - The third component of the vec4.
      w - The fourth component of the vec4.

    • setUniformi

      public void setUniformi(@Nonnull String name, int v1)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified int value.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform to set.
      v1 - The new int value.

    • setUniformi

      public void setUniformi(@Nonnull String name, int v1, int v2)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified int values (two values = ivec2).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform to set.
      v1 - The first int value of the ivec2.
      v2 - The second int value of the ivec2.

    • setUniformi

      v3 - The third int value of the ivec3.

    • setUniformi

      public void setUniformi(@Nonnull String name, int v1, int v2, int v3, int v4)
      Sets the uniform with the specified name to the specified int values (four values = ivec4).
      Parameters:

      v1 - The first int value of the ivec4.
      v2 - The second int value of the ivec4.
      v3 - The third int value of the ivec4.
      v4 - The fourth int value of the ivec4.

    • setUniformMatrix4f

      public void setUniformMatrix4f(@Nonnull String name, @Nonnull CoreMatrix4f matrix)
      Sets the uniform mat4 with the specified name to the specified matrix (Matrix4f).
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform.
      matrix - The matrix4f to set.

    • setUniformfArray

      public void setUniformfArray(@Nonnull String name, @Nonnull float... values)
      Sets the uniform float array with the specified name to a new value.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the uniform.
      values - The new float array to set.

    • getAttribLocation

      public int getAttribLocation(@Nonnull String name)
      Gets the location of the vertex attribute with the specified name.
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the vertex attribute.
      Returns:
      The generic vertex attribute index value

    • bindAttribLocation

      public void bindAttribLocation(@Nonnull String name, int index)
      Manually binds the vertex attribute with the specified name to the specified index value. You'll need to call this method before calling the link() method!
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the vertex attribute.
      index - The new index you want to give the vertex attribute.

    • activate

      public void activate()
      Activates this program.
